channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN

item.title: Report X-2024110551
item.description:
Report X-2024110551

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-10
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered during sort operations. The fiberboard box contained two plastic bottles bot inside of plastic bags. The cap of on of the bottles was loose spilling the contents. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024110496
item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the unloading process a plastic jerrycan was dropped and hit the edge of the catwalk. The jerrycan was punctured on the bottom causing a release. It was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declarartion will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024110487
item.description:
Report X-2024110487

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-01
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. Inner content: 4 glass bottles x 4 liters each packed in a UN4G fiberboard box with molded paper crate inside covering the bottles for protection against movement. Product information: DOM:04JAN2024, PP05, Lot: LP1487-1-37, PM7401/PM7402. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the customer.

item.title: Report E-2024110323
item.description:
Report E-2024110323

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T00:59:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-29
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 03:25ET XPO called to report a 15-gallon release of a toxic material "Pyrethroid pesticide" from a 55-gallon DM. The drum was punctuated by a forklift blade. The terminal cleaned up the release prior to calling ERTS. Waste was placed for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024110411
item.description:
Report X-2024110411

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-15T12:23:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-06
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with an odor was presented to the MEMH spill office. While investigating the shipment the agent found that the bottom chime of the metal can inside was damaged causing a release. The can was packaged in a plastic bag with a fiberboard divider and a empty can for dunnage. It was placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper will be contacted for an amended declaration for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024110192
item.description:
Report E-2024110192

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-13T12:22:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-10
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0325 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal NKX. It was reported that approximately 0.5-gallonsof INTERTHERM 181 GRAY PART A released from a plastic bucket due to improper packaging. The release impacted inside of trailer #3115871. Terminal personnel had proper PPE to handle.
